title: Slayer task/Aviansies

properties.name: description
properties.value: Aviansies can be assigned as a slayer task provided that players have access to the God Wars Dungeon (requiring completion of Death Plateau) and has unlocked Watch the birdie slayer perk for 80 Slayer reward points.

Aviansies

Aviansies can be assigned as a slayer task provided that players have access to the God Wars Dungeon (requiring completion of Death Plateau) and has unlocked Watch the birdie slayer perk for 80 Slayer reward points.

Aviansies can be found in the normal and Wilderness God Wars Dungeon; as followers of Armadyl, Armadylean God-aligned items are required to make them tolerant. Aviansies have an increased sense of danger and will attack players if they are attacked, even if they're in combat with another monster. Their flying height means that they can only be harmed with ranged and magic, although salamanders are an exception as a melee weapon.

Aviansies have a somewhat generous drop table that mostly revolves around adamantite bars, runite limbs, ensouled aviansie heads and poisoned rune daggers, the limbs and daggers having reasonable high alchemy price. In order to get noted bars from the aviansies in the main dungeon, the player has to complete the hard set of the Fremennik Diaries; those in the Wilderness always drop it noted.

Kree'arra and his bodyguards can be killed as alternatives for an aviansie task, but not the Armadylean-aligned spiritual warriors, rangers and mages. Due to the general lack of popularity with aviansies, they are usually toggled off unless killing Kree'arra.

Monster Variants[edit | edit source]

Monster Combat level Slayer XP Locations Notes
Aviansie 69-148 70-139 God Wars Dungeon
  • Killing them contributes to Armadylean kill count.
Aviansie 69-137 70-124 Wilderness God Wars Dungeon
Kree'arra 580 357 God Wars Dungeon
  • 70 Ranged, a crossbow and mith grapple required to access.
  • For more information on fighting Kree'arra, see Kree'arra/Strategies
Flight Kilisa 159 132.5 God Wars Dungeon
  • 70 Ranged, a crossbow and mith grapple required to access.
Wingman Skree 143 124 God Wars Dungeon
  • 70 Ranged, a crossbow and mith grapple required to access.
Flockleader Geerin 149 132.5 God Wars Dungeon
  • 70 Ranged, a crossbow and mith grapple required to access.

Location Comparisons[edit | edit source]

Location Maplink Amount Multicombat Cannonable Safespottable Notes
God Wars Dungeon Maplink 36 Yes No No
  • Aviansies are considered Armadylean followers.
Wilderness God Wars Dungeon Maplink 8 Yes No No
  • Multicombat area and player killing in this area makes it a very dangerous location.

[[Aviansie]]s can be assigned as a [[slayer task]] provided that players have access to the [[God Wars Dungeon]] (requiring completion of [[Death Plateau]]) and has unlocked ''Watch the birdie'' slayer perk for 80 [[Slayer reward point]]s.

Aviansies can be found in the [[God Wars Dungeon|normal]] and [[Wilderness God Wars Dungeon]]; as followers of [[Armadyl]], Armadylean [[God Wars Dungeon#God equipment|God-aligned items]] are required to make them tolerant. Aviansies have an increased sense of danger and will attack players if they are attacked, even if they're in combat with another monster. Their flying height means that they can only be harmed with ranged and magic, although [[salamander]]s are an exception as a melee weapon.

Aviansies have a somewhat generous drop table that mostly revolves around [[adamantite bar]]s, [[runite limb]]s, [[ensouled aviansie head]]s and [[rune dagger|poisoned rune dagger]]s, the limbs and daggers having reasonable high alchemy price. In order to get noted bars from the aviansies in the main dungeon, the player has to complete the hard set of the [[Fremennik Diary|Fremennik Diaries]]; those in the Wilderness always drop it noted.

[[Kree'arra]] and his bodyguards can be killed as alternatives for an aviansie task, but not the Armadylean-aligned [[spiritual warrior]]s, [[spiritual ranger|ranger]]s and [[spiritual mage|mages]]. Due to the general lack of popularity with aviansies, they are usually toggled off unless killing [[Kree'arra]].
